column1: Duomo#Milan Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Milano; Lombard: Domm de Milan) is the cathedral church of Milan
column2: Italy. Dedicated to Santa Maria Nascente (Saint Mary Nascent)
column3: it is the seat of the Archbishop of Milan
column4: currently Cardinal Angelo Scola.The Gothic cathedral took nearly six centuries to complete. It is the fifth largest cathedral in the world and the largest in the Italian state territory.#church#duomo#45.463952#9.192035

column1: Museo del 900#The Museum of Twentieth Century (Museo del Novecento in Italian) is a modern and contemporary art museum located in the Arengario palace near Duomo square in the centre of Milan. Opened in December 2010

column3: with particularly relevant sections dedicated to Futurism

column1: galleria Vittorio Emanuele II#The Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II is one of the world's oldest shopping malls. Housed within a four-story double arcade in central Milan

column1: Teatro alla Scala#La Scala (abbreviation in Italian language for the official name Teatro alla Scala) is a world-renowned opera house in Milan
column2: Italy. The theatre was inaugurated on 3 August 1778 and was originally known as the New Royal-Ducal Theatre alla Scala (Nuovo Regio Ducale Teatro alla Scala). Most of Italy's greatest operatic artists
column3: and many of the finest singers from around the world
column4: have appeared at La Scala during the past 200 years. Today
column5: the theatre is still recognised as one of the leading opera and ballet theatres in the world and is home to the La Scala Theatre Chorus
column6: La Scala Theatre Ballet and La Scala Theatre Orchestra. The theatre also has an associate school
column7: known as the La Scala Theatre Academy (Italian: Accademia Teatro alla Scala)
column8: which offers professional training in music

column1: Sforza Castle#Sforza Castle (Italian: Castello Sforzesco) is a castle in Milan
